bibl.title: Heaven as Palace. Some Problems of Coptic Funerary Beliefs.
bibl.note: The idea that the deceased had to gain admission in a palace in order to win the blessed state in the next world can be recognized on monuments from the Graeco-Roman Period (funerary texts and representations, mummy shrouds, cartonage mummy covers, funerary stelae).
KÁKOSY László, Heaven as Palace. Some Problems of Coptic Funerary Beliefs.
S. GIVERSEN, M. KRAUSE and P. NAGEL (Edd.), Coptology: Past, Present, and Future = Orientalia Lovaniensia Analecta. 61 (Leuven, 1994) pp. 99-108, 3 figg.
